alert.note: Alert for Burke; Cabarrus; Catawba; Cleveland; Gaston; Iredell; Lincoln; Mecklenburg; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 7:24PM EDT until July 05 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Catawba County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Lincoln County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northwestern Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Central Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Rowan County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northern Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Burke County in western North Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 723 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Hickory to 5 miles northwest of Salisbury, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Huntersville, Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, Salisbury, Newton, Lincolnton, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson and Cherryville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.

area.areaDesc: Burke; Cabarrus; Catawba; Cleveland; Gaston; Iredell; Lincoln; Mecklenburg; Rowan
